content: On October 28, 1995, the Atlanta Braves clinched the World Series title by defeating the Cleveland Indians in Game 6. The Braves won the game 1-0, with Tom Glavine throwing an outstanding eight innings, allowing just one hit, while Mark Wohlers closed it out in the ninth. This victory marked the Braves' first championship since moving to Atlanta and their first overall since 1957, solidifying a decade of dominance in the National League.
